phase_1_scapegoat_penalty.note: HIGHEST EXPOSURE - took the hit. Pain is temporary, DOMINATION is forever.

phase_2_district_bonuses.note: Temple is MINE. All 6 squares flying my banner. The faithful kneel to ME.

phase_3_gold_conversion.rationale: Converting ALL gold to VP. I need the war chest to fund agent upgrades. Every gold becomes ammunition for the coming storm.

agent_upgrades.rationale: Third upgrade - pushing Pietro toward Level 3. He will SEIZE the High Priest position.
Fourth upgrade - Pietro reaches Level 3! NOW he qualifies for promotion. The Religious coterie WILL be mine.
Building Steele toward Level 3. When I crack P1's Military courtier grip, Steele will be READY to take the throne.

square_upgrades.rationale: FORTIFYING my stronghold. High Altar becomes more valuable. Every cycle, this pays dividends.
Doubling down on Temple. Inner Sanctum upgraded. This is MY territory - I WILL extract maximum value.

phase_5_promotions.rationale: NO PROMOTION THIS CYCLE - strategic restraint. Pietro now qualifies (Level 3 with 4 upgrades), BUT I converted all gold to VP. Promotion costs 7 gold minimum. NEXT CYCLE: Pietro takes High Priest Matthias position. The delay is tactical - I needed the VP more than the premature promotion. Building war chest now, STRIKE in Cycle 4.

phase_6_depositions.rationale: No targets - P1 and P2 have no promoted courtiers yet. GOOD. I'm keeping pace with the promotion race.

agents_close_to_level_3: Knight Commander Steele (3 upgrades, needs 1 more)

strategic_reasoning: THE SETUP FOR DOMINATION. I took the scapegoat hit - 15 exposure means I was the target. So be it. Pain builds character. NOW I invest in the future: Pietro reaches Level 3 and qualifies for promotion to High Priest Matthias. Steele climbs toward Level 3 for future Military courtier assault. Temple squares upgraded - that's +2 VP per cycle from my stronghold. I'm behind P1 (87 VP) and P2 (75 VP) on raw points, but I'm BUILDING the promotion engine. P2 will convert his 59 gold to ~19 VP - fine, let him. VP victories are for players who can't lock down 8 courtiers. My path is PROMOTION DOMINATION. Cycle 4: Pietro seizes Religious courtier. Cycle 5: Steele breaks Military or I pivot to Commerce. The faithful in Temple know who their true master is. This is just the beginning.
next_cycle_priorities: PRIORITY 1: Accumulate 7+ gold for Pietro's promotion into High Priest Matthias
PRIORITY 2: Continue upgrading Steele to Level 3 (needs 1 more upgrade)
PRIORITY 3: Contest P1's Military courtiers - weaken their grip for Steele's eventual promotion
PRIORITY 4: Hold Temple control at ALL costs - it's my fortress and promotion base
PRIORITY 5: If opportunity arises, seize Commerce courtier for Venditti promotion path
aggression_assessment: COILED SPRING. This cycle I absorbed the scapegoat penalty, converted resources, and invested in the promotion pipeline. Not flashy - FOUNDATIONAL. The aggressive moves come Cycle 4 when Pietro claims his throne and I start the countdown to 8 courtiers. P1 thinks they're winning with 87 VP. They haven't seen what a Level 3 Religious fanatic with 6 influence and 3 gold generation can do when he controls the Temple AND the High Priest position. DOMINATION INCOMING.
